alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 25 at 5:54AM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Wind speeds have slackened to speeds of 25 to 35 mph this morning. That trend should continue through the remainder of the morning. However, strong west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible on Sunday. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County and North Snowy Range Foothills. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers at mile marker 71 on Interstate 25.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills
